meico.msm

Class Msm

  • java.lang.Object
    • meico.xml.XmlBase
      • meico.msm.AbstractMsm
        • meico.msm.Msm

  • public class Msm
extends AbstractMsm
    This class holds data in msm format (Musical Sequence Markup).
    Author:
    Axel Berndt.

      converts the msm data into a midi sequence and create a midi object from it
      Pitches exportPitches()
      export absolute pitches from the MSM score data with 12 semitones per octave in equal temperament and A = 440 Hz, this conforms to the MIDI standard with 0 being the lowest and 127 the highest possible pitch.
      Pitches exportPitches(Key key)
      export absolute pitches from the MSM score data
      void fitMidiPitches(double min, double max)
      make sure that the MIDI pitch values are in the specified limits; if they break the limits, the pitches are transposed down/up
      private void fitVelocities(double min, double max)
      This method checks whether the velocity values hold the specified limits.
      double getEndDate()
      returns the date of the last note's offset (not in milliseconds but in MIDI ticks!)

      a getter for the global environment

      • setPulsesPerQuarter

        public void setPulsesPerQuarter(int ppq)
        Set the pulses per quarter timing resolution attribute. Be careful with this, it does not change any midi date values! It is safer to invoke convertPPQ().
        Parameters:
        ppq -

      • removeRests

        public void removeRests()
        removes all rest elements from the score lists; this method is not part of the mei.exportMsm() cleanup procedure as some applications may still need the rests; others who don't, can call this method to remove all rest elements and get a purged msm

      • resolveSequencingMaps

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> resolveSequencingMaps()
        this method expands all global and local maps according to the sequencingMaps; if a local sequencingMap (can be empty) is given in a certain part, that part ignores the global sequencingMap
        Returns:
        a hashmap with xml:id mappings for those elements that have been copied and needed an updated id, the key-value pair is (id of the original, id of the clone), and later (id of the previous clone, id of another clone)

      • applySequencingMapToMap

        public static nu.xom.Element applySequencingMapToMap(nu.xom.Element sequencingMap,
                                                     nu.xom.Element map,
                                                     java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> repetitionIDs)
        apply the sequencingMap to the map; this expands the map
        Parameters:
        sequencingMap -
        map -
        repetitionIDs - this hashmap will be filled with mappings of xml:id's that are extended to avoid double occurrences
        Returns:
        the expanded map (to replace the old map) or null (to keep the old map)

      • writeMsm

        public boolean writeMsm()
        writes the msm document to an msm file at this.file (it must be != null); if there is already an msm file with this name, it is replaces!
        Returns:
        true if success, false if an error occured

      • writeMsm

        Parameters:
        filename - the filename string; it should include the path and the extension .msm
        Returns:

      • exportMidi

        public Midi exportMidi()
        converts the msm data into a midi sequence and create a meico.Midi object from it; the tempo is 120bpm by default
        Returns:
        the midi object created or null if this msm object is empty or something else wnet wrong

      • exportMidi

        public Midi exportMidi(boolean generateProgramChanges)
        converts the msm data into a midi sequence and create a meico.Midi object from it; the tempo is 120bpm by default
        Parameters:
        generateProgramChanges - if true, program change events are generated (useful for MIR and as a cheap kind of piano reduction); but be careful: if your channel is set on trumpet it would not be set on piano automatically, you have to take care!
        Returns:

      • exportMidi

        public Midi exportMidi(double bpm)
        converts the msm data into a midi sequence and create a midi object from it
        Parameters:
        bpm - the tempo of the midi track
        Returns:

      • exportMidi

        public Midi exportMidi(double bpm,
                       boolean generateProgramChanges)
        converts the msm data into a midi sequence and create a midi object from it
        Parameters:
        bpm - the tempo of the midi track
        generateProgramChanges - if true, program change events are generated (useful for MIR and as a cheap kind of piano reduction); but be careful: if your channel is set on trumpet it would not be set on piano automatically, you have to take care!
        Returns:
        the midi object created or null if this msm object is empty or something else went wrong

      • exportExpressiveMidi

        public Midi exportExpressiveMidi()
        This method should only be invoked when performance rendering has already been applied to this MSM so it has the additional expression attributes (milliseconds.date, velocity etc.). It renders the MIDI on the basis of these attributes. If they are missing, the non-performance specific counterpart attributes are used. But be warned, the result may be surprising due to potential data inconsistency!
        Returns:

      • exportExpressiveMidi

        public Midi exportExpressiveMidi(Performance performance)
        this method applies the specified performance to the msm data and exports expressive midi
        Parameters:
        performance -
        Returns:

      • exportExpressiveMidi

        public Midi exportExpressiveMidi(Performance performance,
                                 boolean generateProgramChanges)
        this method applies the specified performance to the msm data and exports expressive midi
        Parameters:
        performance -
        generateProgramChanges -
        Returns:

      • renderMidi

        private Midi renderMidi(double bpm,
                        boolean generateProgramChanges,
                        boolean exportExpressiveMidi)
        converts the msm data into a midi sequence and create a midi object from it
        Parameters:
        bpm - the tempo of the midi track
        generateProgramChanges - if true, program change events are generated (useful for MIR and as a cheap kind of piano reduction); but be careful: if your channel is set on trumpet it would not be set on piano automatically, you have to take care!
        exportExpressiveMidi - set true to make performance rendering and export expressive MIDI
        Returns:
        the midi object created or null if this msm object is empty or something else went wrong

      • fitMidiPitches

        public void fitMidiPitches(double min,
                           double max)
        make sure that the MIDI pitch values are in the specified limits; if they break the limits, the pitches are transposed down/up
        Parameters:
        min - min inclusive (for MIDI compatibility 0)
        max - max inclusive (for MIDI compatibility 127)

      • fitVelocities

        private void fitVelocities(double min,
                           double max)
        This method checks whether the velocity values hold the specified limits. If not, they are scaled down.
        Parameters:
        min -
        max -

      • computeSemicircleCompression

        private static double computeSemicircleCompression(double x,
                                                   double min,
                                                   double max)
        This method computes a compression of an unlimited input domain (x, the value to be mapped is element of that domain) to a limited output domain (limited by min and max). It uses a semicircle to define a projection into the interval [min, max]. The problem with this method: The projection is always the same and will practically never include the min and max values. The min-max range is practically never fully used.
        Parameters:
        x -
        min -
        max -
        Returns:

      • computePartwiseCompression

        private static void computePartwiseCompression(java.util.ArrayList<KeyValue<java.lang.Double,nu.xom.Attribute>> attributes,
                                               double lowest,
                                               double highest,
                                               double min,
                                               double max)
        This method computes a compression of a limited input domain (lowest ≤ x ≤ highest) to a limited output domain (limited by min and max). It uses a partwise linear mapping. It tries to limit the range of compression depending on how much the limits are broken by lowest and highest value.
        Parameters:
        attributes - the values to be mapped according to the compession
        lowest -
        highest -
        min -
        max -

      • makeInitialTempo

        private void makeInitialTempo(double bpm,
                              javax.sound.midi.Track track)
        This method does not create an exhaustive tempo map; this is left to the performance rendering after extracting a music performance markup structure from mei. However, to specify at least a basic tempo for the midi sequence, created here, we generate one tempo event at the beginning with the specified bpm. The beatlength (beats! per minute) is taken from the denominator of the first global time signature element. If none can be found, 1/4 is the default value.
        Parameters:
        bpm -
        track -

      • makeMillisecondTickTempo

        private void makeMillisecondTickTempo(javax.sound.midi.Track track)
        This method creates an initial tempo where one midi tick corresponds with one millisecond. This is the tempo setting for expressive midi export as the event timing is set by the event dates and not by tempo.
        Parameters:
        track -

      • processPartName

        private void processPartName(nu.xom.Element part,
                             javax.sound.midi.Track track,
                             short channel,
                             boolean generateProgramChanges)
        scan the part attribute name for a known string to create a gm program change and instrument name event
        Parameters:
        part -
        track - the track that shall correspond to the part
        generateProgramChanges - if true, program change events are generated (useful for MIR and as a cheap kind of piano reduction)

        private boolean parseProgramChangeMap(nu.xom.Element part,

                                      short channel,
                                      boolean exportExpressiveMidi)
        parse the elements of the programChangeMap and generate the respective MIDI events
        Parameters:
        part -
        track -
        channel -
        Returns:
        true if there is at least one program change at date 0.0

        Parameters:

        track - the midi track
        exportExpressiveMidi - set true to use the milliseconds dates and durations instead of the raw date and duration attributes

        parse the markerMap and create marker events from it

      • getEndDate

        public double getEndDate()
        returns the date of the last note's offset (not in milliseconds but in MIDI ticks!)
        Returns:

      • exportChroma

        public Pitches exportChroma()
        export standard chroma features with 12 semitones in equal temperament and A = 440 Hz
        Returns:

      • exportPitches

        public Pitches exportPitches()
        export absolute pitches from the MSM score data with 12 semitones per octave in equal temperament and A = 440 Hz, this conforms to the MIDI standard with 0 being the lowest and 127 the highest possible pitch.
        Returns:

      • exportPitches

        public Pitches exportPitches(Key key)
        export absolute pitches from the MSM score data
        Parameters:
        key - the key with reference frequencies and octave modulo setting
        Returns:

        public int addIds()

        the generated ids count
